content: @Bhavik Mehta, I'm interested to hear how you came up with the epic rw proofs in this PR. What combination of pencil&paper and interactive rw was involved?
None! I couldn't sleep last night so I stared at the goal and then wrote the rewrites
(I really should look at rewrite_search again, now that some part of it has been PR'd to mathlib by @Kevin Lacker. This sort of proof is of course what it was originally designed for!)
Do I count a total of 35 rewrites!?!? (in the longest rw [...])
Yeah, it seems to be a record. :-) We should train up gpt on this!
The length of the rewrites does terrify me a little from a proof-fragility point of view. But I guess it is the nature of the beast here.
In hindsight I think that one can be made shorter - I used cancel_epi before I noticed map_tensor, map_left_unitor and map_right_unitor were there; so I feel like the cancel epi was unneeded

Besides that, I'm happy with the PR. There is a question of rewriting the comments in monoidal/transport.lean to reflect that this has been done. That file actually has an out-of-date module doc anyway, so perhaps a follow-up PR for that file is better than doing it here.
Oh yeah that confused me - the next step you mention in that module doc is done right?
